greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of orbits of length n under a map whose periodic points are counted by A056045.
comment: The sequence A056045 records the number of points of period n under a map. The number of orbits of length n for this map gives the sequence above.
link: Y. Puri and T. Ward, Arithmetic and growth of periodic orbits, J. Integer Seqs., Vol. 4 (2001), #01.2.1.
Yash Puri and Thomas Ward, A dynamical property unique to the Lucas sequence, Fibonacci Quarterly, Volume 39, Number 5 (November 2001), pp. 398-402.
formula: a(n) = (1/n)* Sum_{ d divides n } mu(d)*A056045(n/d).
example: a(7) = 1 since the map whose periodic points are counted by A056045 has 1 fixed point and 8 points of period 7, hence 1 orbits of length 7.
results.author: _Thomas Ward_, Mar 13 2001
